CatDescriptText: Walter Shaw, Penn Hills and James Lewis, steelworker, Cliff St., were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 9, 1960, pg. 29 with question "Do you believe the moral standards of our community have deteriorated since World War II?"  Mr. Shaw's answer reads: "This area, like the rest of the world, is a little worse...There doesn't seem to be any respect.  man doesn't have nay use for his fellow man."  Mr. Lewis' answer reads: "They have become worse.  The community is run down and nobody seems to want to do anything about it."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Walter Shaw wearing brimmed hat with dark stripe and plaid coat, standing on sidewalk in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of James Lewis wearing hat with dark stripe, standing on Liberty Avenue near Stanwix Street, Downtown
